This map cannot be uninstalled because it is part of the base app or is required by other features. It will be removed when you uninstall the app.

Your GPS seems to be disabled, do you want to enable it?
You know this : if the Earth's story were told in a 1,000-page book, humanity would appear only in the last paragraph of the very last page.

But this brief story could end sooner than expected. We are isolated in a vast a desolate universe. We destroy everything. We are selfish. We are cruel. We are greedy. We are blind. And we seek to dominate. But we are also capable of empathy, we create wonders, we are resilient, we can be altruistic.
But we have little time. We have made so much progress.. We can build an alternative : a community of rights, of solidarity, of democracy. It's up to us!

Join a global movement, a peaceful awakening. Let's create human waves, a testimony of our true humanity, a strong command to our leaders. Let's gather around cities and countries, all over the world. Let's choose peace. Let's choose joy. Let's choose nature. Let's choose US.
What if just one wave was enough to bring us together?

WorldWideWaves is an ephemeral mobile app with a visionary goal: to orchestrate a series of human waves that ripple through great cities, across countries. Set to unfold over the span of one year, this initiative aims to transcend physical and cultural boundaries, fostering a sense of unity, community, and shared human experience.
At its core, WorldWideWaves is more than just an app, it's a global movement designed to bring people together in a display of solidarity and joy, with shared values.
By leveraging technology, WorldWideWaves will enable participants from around the world to join in these human waves in their cities, creating a powerful visual and emotional spectacle.

In essence, WorldWideWaves is an ambitious endeavor to harness the power of technology for a truly noble cause, connecting humanity in a celebration of unity, joy and collective action. Through each wave, participants will not only contribute to a global spectacle but also feel and share with the world the profound impact of coming together as one.
Welcome to WorldWideWaves! We are excited to have you join the global wave events. To ensure everyone has a safe and enjoyable experience, please follow these guidelines:
Respect for All: Treat all participants with respect, regardless of their background. Please uphold respect for all attendees; discriminatory behavior or harassment is not acceptable.
Respect Public Space: Keep pathways clear, obey local laws and signage, and avoid obstructing traffic or emergency access.
Stay Within Designated Areas: For your safety, remain within the areas designated for the event if any.
Be Responsible: If you choose to drink, do so moderately and in accordance with local laws.
Minimize Environmental Impact: Dispose of all waste in designated receptacles and avoid littering to keep the venues clean.
Report Concerns: If you see something suspicious or someone in distress, immediately report it to local authorities.
Dress Appropriately: Wear comfortable clothing and footwear suitable for the event's activities and weather conditions.
Stay Hydrated: Bring water and stay hydrated, especially during events in warm climates.
Be Mindful of Your Belongings: Keep personal belongings secure and avoid bringing valuables that you do not need.
Use the Buddy System: Stay with friends or make new ones, and look out for each other's safety.
Emergency Ready: Save local emergency numbers in your phone and agree on a meetup spot with friends in case you get separated.
Stay Aware: Identify the nearest safe exits and open spaces (e.g., squares, parks) around you, and follow instructions from local authorities if an emergency occurs.
Emergency Contacts: Save the local emergency number for your location and a personal emergency contact in your phone before you join.
In Case of Emergency: Call the local emergency number, evacuate calmly to a safe open area, assist others if you can, and keep access routes clear.

Liability Waiver: Participation in WorldWideWaves events is at your own risk. By participating, you agree to waive any claims against the app creators related to injuries that could happen during the event.

Public Space Notice: This is a public gathering where photography/filming by attendees or media may occur, subject to local laws. We do not claim rights to your image and cannot control third-party recordings. If you prefer not to appear, try to avoid cameras when possible.
Why isn’t there an event in my city or country?

We selected several dozen of the world’s most populous cities to create a meaningful global wave. Technical and operational constraints currently prevent us from supporting an unlimited number of locations. We aimed for broad representation across continents, cultures, and languages, which can never be perfect. We hope to add more cities over time.

We created original, imaginary continent flags to help you quickly identify cities in the list and to reflect the spirit of unity championed by WorldWideWaves. These flags are not official and exist only in this app; they are not meant to offend or replace any national or cultural symbols. Since there are no official flags for geographic continents, we designed our own for clarity and fun. If you like them, feel free to use them.

WorldWideWaves is a purely private initiative. There is no corporation, association, or government behind it. The creators wanted to offer a constructive way for people who wonder how they can help improve the world and living conditions, an attempt to bring all interested existing progressive and democratic efforts together under a peaceful, apolitical banner.
No. The app is entirely free. While its design and development required time and money from the creators, they receive no direct personal financial benefit in return from it.
Can I contribute to the effort?

Yes, volunteers are always welcome. The app’s code is open-source on GitHub, and you can reach the creators at worldwidewaves@proton.me (replies not guaranteed). The best way to help is to spread the word: share photos and videos from events using the suggested hashtags, contact local influencers to amplify the message, talk about it with your community, and most importantly, join the wave!
Feel the pulse of the Big Apple on Independence Day, as a vibrant wave sweeps past Times Square, Central Park, and the towering skyline.
Experience Hollywood glamour, Pacific breezes, and the star-studded allure of L.A. during a wave that lights up the City of Angels on Independence Day.
Honor Mexican Independence Day in the heart of CDMX, where colonial charm meets modern energy, and mariachi melodies echo through historic plazas.
Let the rhythm of samba and the spirit of Independence Day carry you through bustling Paulista Avenue and the vibrant neighborhoods of this cosmopolitan giant.
Celebrate Argentina's Independence amid tango beats, grand European-style boulevards, and the passionate spirit of porteños along the Río de la Plata.
Revel in the multicultural vibes of Notting Hill Carnival as this wave dances through historic streets, iconic double-decker buses, and the timeless Thames.
On Bastille Day, join a wave that flows from the Eiffel Tower to the Champs-Élysées, celebrating the romance and artistic flair of the City of Light.
Feel the unifying spirit on German Unity Day as the wave traverses the Brandenburg Gate, graffiti-strewn walls, and modern architecture of this vibrant capital.
On Spain's National Day, let the wave ignite Madrid’s lively tapas bars, grand boulevards, and the artistic legacy of the Prado.
On Ferragosto, flow with Romans and visitors alike through piazzas alive with music, fountains, and the holiday energy that fills the Eternal City under the summer sun.
Soak in the grandeur of Red Square and the Kremlin on Russia Day, as the wave echoes the city’s rich imperial history and modern cosmopolitan buzz.
Celebrate Republic Day with a wave that glides past the Bosphorus, historic mosques, and modern squares, as Istanbul lights up with concerts, flags, and fireworks.
Celebrate Eid in Cairo as streets and markets come alive with festive lights, sweet aromas, and joyous families marking the end of Ramadan with a unifying wave.
On Freedom Day, join the wave through the ‘City of Gold,’ where modern skyscrapers meet a rich heritage of resilience and cultural diversity.
Celebrate Madaraka Day amid the lively markets and bustling streets, where urban life converges with the gateway to Kenya's stunning wildlife.
Embrace the energetic rhythms of Afrobeats on Nigeria’s Independence Day, as the wave surges through Africa's most populous city and its lively markets.
On DR Congo’s Independence Day, join a wave rippling through the vibrant capital along the Congo River, brimming with music and cultural pride.
Celebrate UAE National Day surrounded by futuristic skyscrapers, desert landscapes, and the cosmopolitan flair of the world's leading modern metropolis.
Commemorate India's Independence with the spirit of Bollywood, colonial-era architecture, and the monsoon-kissed shores along the Arabian Sea.
Feel the patriotic fervor on Independence Day as the wave sweeps past colonial-era boulevards, Mughal forts, and the heartbeat of India’s capital.
Celebrate freedom in the Silicon Valley of India, where centuries-old temples meet cutting-edge tech parks and a thriving cosmopolitan crowd.
Mark Indonesia's Independence Day in a city of contrasts, from its gleaming skyscrapers to bustling street markets and cultural heritage sites.
Celebrate Thailand’s National Father’s Day honoring King Bhumibol in the City of Angels, where golden temples, floating markets, and vibrant street food ignite your senses.
Celebrate Philippine Independence Day in a city where jeepneys traverse Spanish-colonial churches, lively markets, and modern skyscrapers.
Join millions along the Sumida River as the sky explodes in color, and Tokyo’s summer festival atmosphere sets the perfect stage for a dazzling wave.
Soak in Gwangbokjeol celebrations as the wave passes royal palaces, K-pop hubs, and a skyline that merges tradition with modern innovation.
On Labour Day, ride a wave through Beijing’s parks and boulevards, where millions gather to stroll, picnic, and enjoy the spring holiday spirit.
Let the wave sweep across the Bund and Nanjing Road as Shanghai buzzes with families, music, and the cosmopolitan energy of Labour Day festivities.
Feel the surge of Hong Kong’s Golden Week, as Victoria Harbour, markets, and neon streets overflow with people celebrating Labour Day together.
Ride the wave through Sydney’s Mardi Gras Parade, where Oxford Street bursts with rainbow colors, dazzling floats, and a carnival spirit that unites hundreds of thousands in celebration.
On Melbourne Cup Day, ride a wave through the cultural capital as the city brims with parades, vibrant crowds in elegant attire, and the festive spirit of 'the race that stops a nation'.
On Canada Day, be swept up in a sea of red and white as the wave courses past the CN Tower, multicultural neighborhoods, and the shores of Lake Ontario.
Celebrate Canada Day along the Pacific Coast, weaving through sea-to-sky scenery, Stanley Park’s greenery, and the cosmopolitan charm of downtown.
On Independence Day, enjoy deep-dish delights and the architectural marvels along Lake Michigan as the wave rolls through the Windy City.
Feel the spirit of freedom under the Golden Gate Bridge’s iconic span, as this Independence Day wave travels through hills, cable cars, and diverse neighborhoods.
On Peru's Independence Day, traverse colonial plazas, pre-Incan archaeological sites, and the savory aromas of world-renowned Peruvian cuisine.
Celebrate Colombia's Independence among street art, mountain views, and the cultural beat of salsa-infused neighborhoods in the Andean capital.
Feel the patriotic fervor on Chile’s Independence Day as the wave meanders through the Andes backdrop, colonial facades, and modern glass towers.
Join Tehran’s Sizdah Bedar, the day when families flood parks and gardens for picnics, laughter, and renewal, as a wave sweeps across the city’s lively outdoor gatherings.
Celebrate Pakistan’s Independence Day along the Arabian Sea, through bustling bazaars, rich history, and the dynamic energy of the nation’s largest city.
